page.title: 14LANDSCAPE
page.content: Almost the whole area is low lying marshland with rich alluvium deposit. It has been drained by a criss cross system of rhines which drain into the Severn and protected by a coastal embankment. The south west section of the area is crossed by a limestone anticline largely wooded with non coniferous trees.The north west section is a small coastal region bordering the Severn Estuary. The river bed consists of mudflats, gravel banks and sand. Along the edge of the river is a grassy area called Chittening Warth. There are small farms on the low lying land where the fields and lanes are lined with hedges, willows and some mature trees.
